oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Orders announcing the Confederate victory at Hartsville, Tennessee, December 7, 1862, detailing how the victory was won and thanking all soldiers and officers for their contributions.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides
Broadsides; Tennessee, History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; United States, History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Bragg, Braxton, 1817-1876; Morgan, John Hunt, 1825-1864
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: George G. Garner, Assistant Adjutant General
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: General Braxton Bragg was a Confederate commander during the American Civil War. He led the Army of Tennessee at the battles of Perryville, Stones River & Tullahoma, Chickamauga, and Chattanooga. The battle mentioned in this order is the Battle of Hartsville, where Confederate Colonel John Hunt Morgan crossed the Cumberland River and defeated U.S. Colonel Absalom Moore in a short skirmish outside Hartsville, Tenn.
